titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: The American Entomological Society is the oldest continuously operating entomological society in the Western Hemisphere, founded on March 1, 1859. The American Entomological Society (AES) supports entomological research, education and outreach through publications, meetings, Annual Insect Field Day, the AES Library, and awards for young entomologists.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of publications of the American Entomological Society. Issues include: Transactions, Vols. 1-111 (1867-1985); Entomological News, Vols 1-83 (1890-1972); Memoirs of the American Entomological Society, Nos. 1-35 (1916-1986); and Proceedings of the Entomological Society of Philadelphia, Vols. 1-5 (1861-1865). The collection also includes three library accession books (1859-1967), arranged by accession number, which include author, title, publication year, and source. The level of detail of the accession entries varies.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia: Ezra Townsend Cresson papers (AES membership cards) and Rudolf G. Schmieder papers.
